heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 30 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-easterly (147°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 83.0 degrees.    In the UK, a south-easterly wind can bring cold and damp weather (especially in the winter.)

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 214 m), feels like temperature (down 2.4°C), dew point temperature (down 2.8°C), and outside temperature (down 2.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 187.5m higher than yesterday, 137.7m lower than the past week, 213.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 696m and a peak of 976m, averaging 1022.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
